review: So far I have only used it to access my subscription to Sling TV.  For that purpose, it works just fine.  Most other channels available are duplicates of what I can access through my wi-fi enabled Blu-Ray player.  Since I don't play games or listen to radio with my TV, I probably will not use it for more that Sling TV.  Besides, most movies that I might want to watch are either not available or have a rental fee attached.  I can rent DVD's locally for less that the streaming rental fees.

review: I don't know if I'm using this wrong, but I have literally not even gotten a single spark while using this.If first thought I try it out by lightning our fireplace, because we have a natural gas assist so it's fairly easy to start. I made sure it had fresh batteries and the lights came on, but nothing. Not a spark. I tried several times then went ahead and used a cheap dollar store fire stixk, which worked immediately. So I know it's not our fireplace.Thinking maybe it was meant for outside use, we tried the next weekend to start the grill and then a campfire. The grill is a standard charcoal grill. Again, no luck with that. Maybe it was the liquid firestarter that caused the problem here?  So we tried a camp fire with no accelerants, all natural wood, twigs and some bits of paper for the Firestick to light. Nada.I'm not sure what we're doing wrong. I plug the USB part into the USB port on my computer, then aimed the Firestick directly at the item we wished to ignite. I didn't even see a spark or anything! But I thought maybe it is all done with infrared, so no sparks. What is so puzzling is that it didn't seem to matter what I was trying to light,  nothing worked, there wasn't a spark or even a puff of smoke, let alone an actual fire.The device seems well made, maybe I got a faulty unit. It seems like other reviewers like it, so I know it's just got to be something I'm doing wrong. Will keep trying and will update you if I figure it out.PS: another strange thing, when I plugged the USB into my TV instead (thinking that since maybe it has more  power, it might help ignite better) I suddenly started getting all kinds of channels with tons of shows and even some games.  I don't have cable, so I'm not sure what's going on here. A strange development to be certain!
